content:
DataColumnCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of DataColumn objects for a DataTable.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("CollectionChanged")]
[System.ComponentModel.Editor("Microsoft.VSDesigner.Data.Design.ColumnsCollectionEditor, Microsoft.VSDesigner, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
public sealed class DataColumnCollection : System.Data.InternalDataCollectionBase
Inheritance
Object
System.Data.InternalDataCollectionBase
DataColumnCollection

Inherited Members

CopyTo(Array,Int32)
Count
GetEnumerator()

ToString()

Remarks

The DataColumnCollection defines the schema of a DataTable, and determines what kind of data each DataColumn can contain. You can access the DataColumnCollection through the Columns property of the DataTable object.

The DataColumnCollection uses the Add and Remove methods to insert and delete DataColumn objects. Use the Count property to determine how many DataColumn objects are in the collection. Use the Contains method to verify whether a specified index or column name exists in the collection.

Properties

Item(Int32)

Gets the DataColumn from the collection at the specified index.

public System.Data.DataColumn this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the column to return.

Value
DataColumn

The DataColumn at the specified index.

Exceptions
IndexOutOfRangeException

The index value is greater than the number of items in the collection.

Remarks

The Contains method can be used to test for the existence of a column. This is useful before you try to use Item.

Item(String)

Gets the DataColumn from the collection with the specified name.

public System.Data.DataColumn this[string name] { get; }
name
String

The stem.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName* of the column to return.

Value
DataColumn

The DataColumn in the collection with the specified stem.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName*; otherwise a null value if the DataColumn does not exist.

Remarks

Item is conditionally case-sensitive when it searches for column names. For example, if one DataColumn is named "mydatacolumn" and another is named "Mydatacolumn", a string used to search for one of the columns is regarded as case-sensitive. However, if "mydatacolumn" exists and "Mydatacolumn" does not, the search string is regarded as case-insensitive.

List 

protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }
Value
ArrayList

To be added.

Methods

Add()

Creates and adds a DataColumn object to the DataColumnCollection.

public System.Data.DataColumn Add ();
Returns
DataColumn

The newly created DataColumn.

Remarks

A default name ("Column1", "Column2", and so on) is given to the column.

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Add(DataColumn)

Creates and adds the specified DataColumn object to the DataColumnCollection.

public void Add (System.Data.DataColumn column);
column
DataColumn

The DataColumn to add.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The column parameter is null.

ArgumentException

The column already belongs to this collection, or to another collection.

DuplicateNameException

The collection already has a column with the specified name. (The comparison is not case-sensitive.)

InvalidExpressionException

The expression is invalid. See the stem.Data.DataColumn.Expression* property for more information about how to create expressions.

Remarks

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Add(String)

Creates and adds a DataColumn object that has the specified name to the DataColumnCollection.

public System.Data.DataColumn Add (string columnName);
columnName
String

The name of the column.

Returns
DataColumn

The newly created DataColumn.

Exceptions
DuplicateNameException

The collection already has a column with the specified name. (The comparison is not case-sensitive.)

Remarks

By default, the DataType for the new column is string.

If null or an empty string ("") is passed in for the name, a default name ("Column1", "Column2", and so on) is given to the column.

Use the Contains method to determine whether a column with the proposed name already exists in the collection.

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Add(String,Type)

Creates and adds a DataColumn object that has the specified name and type to the DataColumnCollection.

public System.Data.DataColumn Add (string columnName, Type type);
columnName
String

The stem.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName* to use when you create the column.

type
Type

The stem.Data.DataColumn.DataType* of the new column.

Returns
DataColumn

The newly created DataColumn.

Exceptions
DuplicateNameException

The collection already has a column with the specified name. (The comparison is not case-sensitive.)

InvalidExpressionException

The expression is invalid. See the stem.Data.DataColumn.Expression* property for more information about how to create expressions.

Remarks

If null or an empty string ("") is passed in for the name, a default name ("Column1", "Column2", and so on) is given to the column.

Use the Contains method to determine whether a column with the proposed name already exists in the collection.

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Add(String,Type,String)

Creates and adds a DataColumn object that has the specified name, type, and expression to the DataColumnCollection.

public System.Data.DataColumn Add (string columnName, Type type, string expression);
columnName
String

The name to use when you create the column.

type
Type

The stem.Data.DataColumn.DataType* of the new column.

expression
String

The expression to assign to the stem.Data.DataColumn.Expression* property.

Returns
DataColumn

The newly created DataColumn.

Exceptions
DuplicateNameException

The collection already has a column with the specified name. (The comparison is not case-sensitive.)

InvalidExpressionException

The expression is invalid. See the stem.Data.DataColumn.Expression* property for more information about how to create expressions.

Remarks

If null or an empty string ("") is passed in for the name, a default name ("Column1", "Column2", and so on) is given to the column.

Use the Contains method to determine whether a column with the proposed name already exists in the collection.

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

AddRange(DataColumn[])

Copies the elements of the specified DataColumn array to the end of the collection.

public void AddRange (System.Data.DataColumn[] columns);
columns
DataColumn[]

The array of DataColumn objects to add to the collection.

CanRemove(DataColumn)

Checks whether a specific column can be removed from the collection.

public bool CanRemove (System.Data.DataColumn column);
column
DataColumn

A DataColumn in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the column can be removed. false if,

  • The column parameter is null.

  • The column does not belong to this collection.

  • The column is part of a relationship.

  • Another column's expression depends on this column.

Remarks

The CanRemove method performs several checks before returning a true or false result. This includes the following: whether the column exists, belongs to the table, or is involved in a constraint or relation.

Use the CanRemove method before you try to remove any column from a collection. You can also use the Contains method to determine whether a particular column exists before you try to remove it.

Clear()

Clears the collection of any columns.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Contains(String)

Checks whether the collection contains a column with the specified name.

public bool Contains (string name);
name
String

The stem.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName* of the column to look for.

Returns
Boolean

true if a column exists with this name; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the Contains method to confirm the existence of a column before you perform additional operations on the column. The method returns false when two or more columns have the same name but different namespaces. The call does not succeed if there is any ambiguity when matching a column name to exactly one column.

CopyTo(DataColumn[],Int32)

Copies the entire collection into an existing array, starting at a specified index within the array.

public void CopyTo (System.Data.DataColumn[] array, int index);
array
DataColumn[]

An array of DataColumn objects to copy the collection into.

index
Int32

The index to start from.

IndexOf(DataColumn)

Gets the index of a column specified by name.

public int IndexOf (System.Data.DataColumn column);
column
DataColumn

The name of the column to return.

Returns
Int32

The index of the column specified by column if it is found; otherwise, -1.

Remarks

The IndexOf method is not case-sensitive.

IndexOf(String)

Gets the index of the column with the specific name (the name is not case sensitive).

public int IndexOf (string columnName);
columnName
String

The name of the column to find.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the column with the specified name, or -1 if the column does not exist in the collection.

Remove(DataColumn)

Removes the specified DataColumn object from the collection.

public void Remove (System.Data.DataColumn column);
column
DataColumn

The DataColumn to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The column parameter is null.

ArgumentException

The column does not belong to this collection.

-Or-

The column is part of a relationship.

-Or-

Another column's expression depends on this column.

Remarks

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Remove(String)

Removes the DataColumn object that has the specified name from the collection.

public void Remove (string name);
name
String

The name of the column to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The collection does not have a column with the specified name.

Remarks

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the column at the specified index from the collection.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index of the column to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The collection does not have a column at the specified index.

Remarks

If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing columns, the CollectionChanged event occurs.

Events

CollectionChanged

Occurs when the columns collection changes, either by adding or removing a column.

public event System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventHandler CollectionChanged;

Remarks

Use the Contains and CanRemove methods to determine whether a column exists and can be removed.
